metadata.name: Potential Arbitrary Command Execution Using Msdt.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects processes leveraging the "ms-msdt" handler or the "msdt.exe" binary to execute arbitrary commands as seen in the follina (CVE-2022-30190) vulnerability

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\msdt.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('msdt.exe') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('it_browseforfile=')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' pcwdiagnostic')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -af ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' /af ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' –af ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' —af ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' ―af ')))))

output.summary: Detects processes leveraging the "ms-msdt" handler or the "msdt.exe" binary to execute arbitrary commands as seen in the follina (CVE-2022-30190) vulnerability
